args.natural_language_statement: Show that SL(n) is a normal subgroup of GL(n) and that GL(n)/SL(n) is isomorphic to the multiplicative group R^× of nonzero real numbers. Translate into Lean4 (Mathlib) code: state definitions of GL(n, ℝ) as invertible matrices, SL(n, ℝ) as those with determinant = 1, prove SL n ⊲ GL n and produce an isomorphism GL n / SL n ≃* (ℝˣ) given by determinant map descending to quotient. End the statement with := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

/-- SL(n) is a normal subgroup of GL(n), and GL(n)/SL(n) is isomorphic (as a multiplicative group)
    to the units of the real field via the determinant map. -/
theorem gl_sl_det_quotient (n : ℕ) :
  IsNormal (Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup n ℝ) ∧
  (Matrix.GeneralLinearGroup n ℝ) ⧸ (Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup n ℝ) ≃* (Units ℝ) := by sorry
